name: Pash Cracken: Master Pilot Quiz | Star Wars Books | 10 Questions

questions.text: Pash's father also worked for the Rebellion.
questions.explanation:
True.

	General Airen Cracken was the head of Rebel Intelligence, and was able to secure a spot for his son in the Imperial Academy.

questions.text: When Pash first entered Rogue Squadron, he accepted a reduction in rank. What was his rank after joining?
questions.explanation:
Lieutenant.

	When he commanded his own squadron, Pash was a captain, but he accepted a reduction to lieutenant to serve in Rogue Squadron.

questions.text: What was Pash's callsign in Rogue Squadron?
questions.explanation:
Rogue Four.

	The callsign was previously held by Bror Jace, who was murdered sometime before the events of "X-Wing: Wedge's Gamble". Tycho Celchu held both Rogue Null and Rogue Two, and Wedge Antilles was once a Rogue Three.

questions.text: Which language did Pash NOT speak?
questions.explanation:
Japanese.

	In addition to Basic, Huttese and sufficient Yuuzhan Vong, Pash also spoke Bothese, used by Bothans. However, he did not speak Japanese.

questions.text: Before flying an X-Wing in Rogue Squadron, which starfighter did Pash fly?
questions.explanation:
A-Wings.

	Pash's squadron flew A-Wings, which were extremely fast thanks to their thrusters. This made them suitable for hit-and-run tactics.

questions.text: What was Pash's rank at the outbreak of the Yuuzhan Vong war?
questions.explanation:
Major.

	Pash Cracken was a major in the New Republic Defense Force. Soon made an acting general, he was given command of the ship "Memory of Ithor".

questions.text: Pash was held prisoner twice during the Yuuzhan Vong war.
questions.explanation:
True.

	His starship destroyed, Pash was held prisoner on the planet Selvaris. His second imprisonment came as he was defending Caluula Station.

questions.text: Pash was flying solo by the age of 13.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Surely a testament to his piloting abilities! Pash graduated near the top of his class.

questions.text: Which planet does Pash hail from?
questions.explanation:
Contruum.

	Contruum had two large moons, and the human population was largely situated in the world's tropic areas. It had plenty of borium deposits, making it a valuable planet.

questions.text: Pash led seventy-two starfighters to defect to the Rebel Alliance.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After graduating from the Imperial Academy, Pash was given his own wing of starfighters, which he promptly led over to the Alliance. Possessing a grand sense of morals, Pash knew of the Empire's evil all along.
